titlestmt.subtitle:
An inventory of
its records at Syracuse University

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Galley proofs, drafts, and some correspondence of the American printing company. Customers include the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Frick Collection, among others.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Spiral Press was an American fine press founded by Joseph Blumenthal (1897-1990) in 1926. Between 1926 and its closure in 1971, the press designed and printed books for or by Robert Frost, W. H. Auden, Pablo Neruda, William Carlos Williams, Robinson Jeffers and Franklin Delano Roosevelt. The press's institutional clients included the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Morgan Library, Museum of Modern Art, Frick Collection, Random House, and CBS Television Network.

Blumenthal also designed a typeface, Spiral, which he named after the press, and wrote and taught on fine printing and book arts. In recognition of his attention to detail and high standards of excellence in his work, he was awarded the American Institute of Graphic Arts’ Lifetime Achievement Award in 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Spiral Press Records consist of a small number of general files and production files.

The General files contain several pamphlets, one letter, and a Spiral Press bibliography, but the vast majority of the collection consists of the Production files for 1961 and 1962. Within the folders one may find various galley proofs, draft copies for letterheads, envelopes, and invitations, and, in some cases, correspondence between the customer and the Spiral Press.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p:
The production folders are arranged consecutively by job number as follows:
Box 1 - Job no's 1433-3000
Box 2 - Job no's 3001-3075
Box 3 - Job no's 3076-3155
Box 4 - Job no's 3156-3220
Box 5 - Job no's 3221-3300
Box 6 - Job no's 3301-3355
Box 7 - Job no's 3356-3415
Box 8 - Job no's 3416-3490
Box 9 - Job no's 3491-3550
Box 10 - Job no's 3551-3615
Box 11 - Job no's 3616-3680
Box 12 - Job no's 3681-3745
Box 13 - Job no's 3746-3797
To simplify locating a specific customer, however, the list below is given alphabetically by customer, with the job number and box information following the customer name.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has the records of several publishers and printers. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: One copy of Robert Frost and the Spiral Press has been transferredd to Rare Books for cataloging. The other copy remains in the collection, in Series I, Box 1.

controlaccess.head: Subject and Genre Headings
controlaccess.subject: Literature -- American Fiction
Literature -- American Poetry
Publishing, printing and book arts
Fine books -- Publishing.
Printers and printing -- United States -- History -- 20th century.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

did.unittitle: Letter to Joseph Blumenthal from Howard L. Applegate
The Individual and the Mass / August Heckscher
Leonard Baskin's speech of acceptance on receiving the medal of the American Institute of Graphic Arts New York
The Nobel Prize Speech / William Faulkner
On Book Design and Printing in the Twentieth Century / Joseph Blumenthal
The Place of the Artist in Society / President John F. Kennedy
The Prophets Really Prophesy as Mystics, The Commentators Merely by Statistics / Robert Frost

unittitle.emph: Robert Frost and the Spiral Press
